result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas L Gonzales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 10/01/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 9 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.
With Huber. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

defendant.name: Gonzales, Lucas L

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lucas L Gonzales in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #2:
HUBER: 90 DAYS with standard release conditions.  Defendant was remanded into custody and sentence to begin forthwith. 

COSTS: $243.00 (to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 10/1/16 or serve 9 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment).

DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00  (to be paid at $25.00 per month consecutive to payment on costs).

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Lucas L Gonzales in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chesshire requests the court set the case for plea and sentencing in about 30 days.  The Court schedules accordingly.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Lucas L Gonzales in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     The Attorney advises the Court he has received discovery and an offer.  The Attorney to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lucas L Gonzales
Current: S31 W28443 Sunset Dr, Waukesha, WI 53189 United States  (Effective: 02-18-2016)
Prior: P.O. Box 05911, c/o Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, Milwaukee, WI 53205-0911
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Lucas L Gonzales in court, in custody and by video Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicates he will be released March 1, 2016.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lucas L Gonzales in court, in custody by video conference.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez appears as friend of the court.  Defendant set to be released on March 1, 2016.  Atty. Martinez states one of the witnesses is a former client and Atty. Martinez might not be able to represent Lucas Gonzales.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Informing defendant that proper paperwork including indigency evaluation must be completed before an attorney can be appointed.
